comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -252,7 +252,7 @@ SCENARIO("passing requirements increment the 'good' counter") {
       auto silent_expr = [&] {                                                 \
         auto bk = caf::test::logger::instance().make_quiet();                  \
         auto guard = caf::detail::make_scope_guard(                            \
-          [bk] { caf::test::logger::instance().levels(bk); });                 \
+          [bk]() noexcept { caf::test::logger::instance().levels(bk); });      \
comment.body: Adding `noexcept` here requires that we also add `noexcept` to `levels` in `libcaf_test/caf/test/unit_test.hpp`.

pull_request.title: Restrict scope guard to noexcept functions
pull_request.body:
Like discussed before, this PR adds a static assert to the scope guard making sure the provided function is noexcept. 
I've also went and added `noexcept` to all lambdas so the solution compiles without issues, however clang tidy does complain a lot about some cases where the lambdas might throw under rare circumstances. 

Closes #1550.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -353,8 +353,10 @@ class CAF_CORE_EXPORT logger {
 #define CAF_PUSH_AID(aarg)                                                     \
   caf::actor_id CAF_PP_UNIFYN(caf_aid_tmp)                                     \
     = caf::logger::thread_local_aid(aarg);                                     \
-  auto CAF_PP_UNIFYN(caf_aid_tmp_guard) = caf::detail::make_scope_guard(       \
-    [=] { caf::logger::thread_local_aid(CAF_PP_UNIFYN(caf_aid_tmp)); })
+  auto CAF_PP_UNIFYN(caf_aid_tmp_guard)                                        \
+    = caf::detail::scope_guard([=]() noexcept {                                \
+        caf::logger::thread_local_aid(CAF_PP_UNIFYN(caf_aid_tmp));             \
+      })
comment.body: If we declare this lambda `noexcept`, we'll also need to declare `thread_local_aid` `noexcept`.

issue.title: Custom logger for the deterministic fixture
issue.body: The deterministic fixture should implement its own logger that prints each log message by calling the appropriate print function on the `reporter`. This logger should then be automatically configured when using the `deterministic` fixture so that log output is automatically included in the test output.

issue.title: Custom logger for the deterministic fixture

This logger should then be automatically configured when using the `deterministic` fixture so that log output is automatically included in the test output.

comment.body: Got it. If you open a PR that closes a ticket, please refer to the ticket with `Closes #...` instead of just `Relates #...` to close the ticket automatically.

commits.message: Improve performance of the mcast operator
Remove obsolete code from merge driver

Merge pull request #1572

Improve performance of the mcast operator
Replace caf_io unit tests with Robot tests

issue.title: Performance issue with the mcast operator
issue.body:
When adding a couple hundred paths to an `mcast` operator, it will spend a lot of time in `mcast::max_buffered()`.

Full context: https://github.com/zeek/broker/issues/352.

commits.message: Improve performance of the mcast operator
Remove obsolete code from merge driver

Merge pull request #1572

Improve performance of the mcast operator

pull_request.title: Improve performance of the mcast operator
pull_request.body:
The `mcast` operator has to keep track of how many items are buffered at the downstream paths. For that, we have a function that iterates all the paths and gets the maximum size for the buffers. Calling this function repeatedly with many paths (a few hundred) is a performance killer. So this redesign tries to avoid as many of these calculations as possible by taking a few shortcuts.

Closes #1418.

repo.description: An Open Source Implementation of the Actor Model in C++

review.body: Glad to be able to review this. Big stamp of approval from me :+1:

pull_request.body:
The `mcast` operator has to keep track of how many items are buffered at the downstream paths. For that, we have a function that iterates all the paths and gets the maximum size for the buffers. Calling this function repeatedly with many paths (a few hundred) is a performance killer. So this redesign tries to avoid as many of these calculations as possible by taking a few shortcuts.

Closes #1418.
